entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: `<datalist>`
entity.description: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionHtml: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionClean: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.

example.codeHighlighted: <input name="country" list="countries"> <datalist id="countries"> <option>Afghanistan</option> ... </datalist>

webFeature.description_html: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types.
webFeature.name: <datalist>

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`
entity.description: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionHtml: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

example.codeHighlighted: <details> <summary>Details</summary> Longer content </details>

webFeature.description_html: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
webFeature.name: <details>

entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.name: Pickers
entity.description: Pain points related to the UI that "picks" a value for an input, such as a calendar or color swatch.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the UI that "picks" a value for an input, such as a calendar or color swatch.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the UI that "picks" a value for an input, such as a calendar or color swatch.

entity.name: Interop issues
entity.description: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).
entity.descriptionHtml: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).
entity.descriptionClean: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).

entity.name: Missing elements
entity.description: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionClean: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.

entity.name: Accessibility
entity.description: Obstacles in providing accessible experiences (regardless of cause), assistive‑tech compatibility, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Obstacles in providing accessible experiences (regardless of cause), assistive‑tech compatibility, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Obstacles in providing accessible experiences (regardless of cause), assistive‑tech compatibility, etc.

entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

entity.name: `<datalist>`
entity.description: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.

entity.descriptionClean: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.

entity.name: <​details>/<​summary>
entity.description: Pain points related to the <details> and <summary> elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the  and  elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the  and  elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.

entity.name: Combobox element
entity.description: The lack of a native, accessible combobox element that combines a text input with a dropdown list of suggestions, similar to `<datalist>` but with more control.
entity.descriptionHtml: The lack of a native, accessible combobox element that combines a text input with a dropdown list of suggestions, similar to <datalist> but with more control.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native, accessible combobox element that combines a text input with a dropdown list of suggestions, similar to <datalist> but with more control.

entity.name: End-user experience
entity.description: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use `ergonomics` for that).
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).

resources.title: Tether elements to each other with CSS anchor positioning

webFeature.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
webFeature.name: Anchor positioning

entity.name: Poor design
entity.description: Fidelity issues that are outside the developer’s control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Fidelity issues that are outside the developer’s control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Fidelity issues that are outside the developer’s control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.
